title: Learning Ownership Development Program Using Generative AI

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and foundational knowledge in social studies
context.additional_context: A mixed-methods case analysis course designed to help pre-service teachers recognize learning ownership while utilizing generative AI as an educational tool

learning_goals: Learners can independently complete social studies design tasks at least three times using generative AI (e.g., ChatGPT).
Learners can explain at least four components of learning ownership—self-efficacy, responsibility, belonging, and identity—in AI-integrated learning processes.
Learners can present at least two arguments for and against the impact of generative AI on educational equity based on case studies.
Learners can write self-assessment reports reflecting on learning experiences with generative AI tools in smartphone environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
